content: How many words can you create using only four letters that describe the beauty of snowfall? Use the formula n(n-1)(n-2)(n-3) to calculate the possible combinations, where n is the number of unique letters in the word.

To determine how many four-letter words can describe the beauty of snowfall using the formula \( n(n-1)(n-2)(n-3) \), we first need to identify the unique letters in the word "snowfall."

The word "snowfall" consists of the letters: S, N, O, W, F, A, L, L. There are 7 unique letters (since 'L' is repeated).

Using the formula with \( n = 7 \):

\[
7 \times 6 \times 5 \times 4 = 840
\]

Therefore, you can create 840 different four-letter combinations using the unique letters from the word "snowfall."
